en-IE.question: How can I watch back live TV content on my Vodafone TV PLAY box?
en-IE.answer:
No worries, you can restart or rewind all major programmes so you will never miss a moment. You can watch back all main Irish TV content and many more under the 7 Day Catch Up menu on your TV. For the majority of channels, simply press the Record button to instantly start or schedule a recording where the content rights allow. For accessing RTÉ content beyond 7 days, open your preloaded RTÉ Player under the Apps section.​

Please note: Due to some licensing agreements, watching back certain UK content such as BBC or Channel 4 can be limited. Channel-specific details available at www.vodafone.ie/tv-features

en-IE.question: How can I activate my NOW Membership?
en-IE.answer:
If you have chosen to add a NOW Entertainment or Sports Bundle to your TV Package, follow the steps below to activate your membership.

Launch the My TV Zone app.
Select your NOW membership icon, scan the QR code, or alternatively enter your phone number to receive a link to the NOW TV Welcome page.
Follow the instructions to register or sign in on your existing NOW account.
After completing the instructions, return to the My TV Zone to see the activation success.
Launch the NOW app in the apps section of your Vodafone TV PLAY and enter your NOW login information.

en-IE.question: How do I log into the Vodafone TV App?
en-IE.answer:
Download the Vodafone TV App on your smartphone or tablet on the Google Play Store or Apple App Store.

Go to the Apps menu of your TV box and open My TV Zone.
After selecting Devices, launch the Vodafone TV App on your mobile or tablet and select the Use TV Box option and follow the steps on your device.
Make sure you create and save a profile, otherwise you will need to repeat the process again when you re-enter the app.

Alternatively, launch the Vodafone TV App on your mobile or tablet, and select the Use Account Details option. 
Register as a new Vodafone TV customer at vodafone.ie by using the username provided on your welcome email, and by creating your own password.
Once you registered, log in to the Vodafone TV app with that same username and password.
Again, make sure you create and save a profile, otherwise you will need to repeat the process again when you re-enter the app.

en-IE.question: What is my PIN?
en-IE.answer:
When purchasing additional memberships in the My TV Zone, you will need to enter a PIN code. This is your Purchase PIN code.

It is the same PIN as the Parental PIN.

The default PIN is 1111.

en-IE.question: How do I get subtitles?
en-IE.answer:
You can manage Accessibility options in Settings, such as Audio Language, Default Language and Audio Description.

To turn on Subtitles: Settings > System Settings > Device Preference > Accessibility > Captions.

en-IE.question: How can I use Google Assistant?
en-IE.answer:
Google Assistant allows you to control your TV using your voice. Your set-top box comes with a built-in microphone that can capture your voice commands.

To activate Google Assistant, you can simply say "Hey Google" or "OK Google" out loud.

Alternatively, if you prefer using the remote control, it has a microphone icon button for voice input. Pressing that button will let you start talking to Google Assistant.

Your remote control must be paired via Bluetooth for the microphone to work. To pair the remote to the TV box via Bluetooth, hold the Number 3 button and the Yellow button for 5 seconds.

en-IE.question: How can I download additional apps?
en-IE.answer:
To access the Google Play Store and download Apps, you must sign in using your Google credentials. There are two ways to sign in:

During the installation process on the TV screen using your remote
Visiting the Google Play Store in the Apps menu on Vodafone TV PLAY

Once you sign into your Google account you can download Apps from the Google Play Store app on your TV.

en-IE.question: How can I purchase additional NOW Memberships and subscriptions?
en-IE.answer:
You can also purchase additional NOW Memberships and other premium packs at anytime using the My TV Zone app on the TV PLAY box.

Additional memberships include NOW Entertainment, NOW Sports, NOW Cinema, NOW Sports Extra, NOW Hayu, & NOW Boost and Racing TV.

en-IE.question: How do I get a multiroom?
en-IE.answer:
You can also purchase an additional Vodafone TV PLAY Set-Top-Box at anytime using the My TV Zone app on the TV PLAY box.

Customers can purchase up to 5 additional TV PLAY boxes.

en-IE.question: I don't see my question, where can I get more information?
en-IE.answer: If you can't see your question, head to our support page at www.vodafone.ie/tv-support or call 1907.

en-IE.question:
Vodafone wants you to receive the most benefit from your TV service with us.
To provide you with our TV service, and to continually improve it, we need to collect information about how you watch TV. We can do this using the Vodafone TV Box or the Vodafone TV app on your devices. For example, we’ll collect information about what you watch (which may include adverts), how long you watched it for and what you did such as pausing, recording, fast-forwarding, etc.
We’ll also use the information to provide reports to third parties such as content providers and advertisers. These reports won’t contain information that may identify you.
We also use the information we collect to be able to charge you the right amount on your next bill (for example, where you have added additional premium content or have elected to charge NOW or other premium streaming apps to your Vodafone bill) as well as other things such as fix faults and send you service messages.
We’ll collect information about what you used to watch your TV content (such as which Vodafone TV Box or which device) and where you watched it (location data, time zones, etc.). We’ll know what you downloaded or purchased. We’ll also know, for example, the IP addresses for any devices, device IDs and/or unique identifiers, your user IDs and passwords for the Vodafone TV app, any device parental control or purchase PIN codes. Your devices such as your Vodafone TV Box will tell us about your use of the services. This information is a requirement to manage functions such as the number of devices and concurrent streams allowed per subscriber, the Geo location in the EU region.  Your TV usage data may be used by Vodafone for analytics or marketing purposes to help us understand how you use our products and services. You can manage your permission for this type of activity by accessing your Vodafone account on our website or on the My Vodafone app.
We’ll use the information to be able to provide you with localised content, to send you viewing recommendations and analyse what you watched so that we can enhance our services further.
If you watch TV through the Vodafone TV app, please also read the Apps section on our website at "https://n.vodafone.ie/privacy/products-and-services.html".
It’s important to flag that certain streaming content providers may have their own terms of use and privacy and cookies policies that may apply to you when you access their content. Content providers include streaming services such as Netflix or NOW. You should check these on their websites to be sure you’re informed on and understand how your information is used.

This TV service will provide you with a personalized recommendations feature that automatically adapts to your usage profile, helping you discover the best content.
To provide this feature, Vodafone collects data on your use of TV service, such as the channels and content you watch, the subscriptions and promotions you subscribe to or content you indicate as favourites.
This feature is optional. You can change your choice at any time in the Settings menu. Click on "I agree" to activate the feature and receive personalised recommendations or, alternatively, choose "Disagree", not to activate the feature and in this way, only have access to generic recommendations, where there is no personalisation this is a test.
